00019 int srvInit( struct Server* server, int master )
00020 {
00021     server->maxThreads = omp_get_max_threads();
00022 
00023     /* TODO read settings from file! */
00024     if ( master ) {
00025 
00026         settings.sockID = socket( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0 );
00027         if ( settings.sockID < 0 ) {
00028             error_at_line( 0, 1, __FILE__, __LINE__, strerror( errno ), 0 );
00029             return 1;
00030         }
00031 
00032         settings.addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00033         settings.addr.sin_port = htons( settings.port );
00034         settings.addr.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00035 
00036         settings.timeout = 100;
00037         settings.path = "./htdocs/";
00038         settings.standardfile = "index.html";
00039 //      settings.domain = "http://bigdaddy.ath.cx:8081";
00040         settings.domain = "localhost:8081";
00041         settings.bufferSize = 4096;
00042 
00043         socklen_t sockOpt = 1;
00044         setsockopt( settings.sockID, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &sockOpt, sizeof( sockOpt ) );
00045 
00046         if ( bind( settings.sockID, ( struct sockaddr * )&settings.addr, sizeof( settings.addr ) ) < 0 ) {
00047             error_at_line( 0, 1, __FILE__, __LINE__, strerror( errno ), 0 );
00048             return 1;
00049         }
00050 
00051         if ( listen( settings.sockID, 1024 ) < 0 ) {
00052             error_at_line( 0, 1, __FILE__, __LINE__, strerror( errno ), 0 );
00053             return 1;
00054         }
00055     }
00056 
00057     /* Init connections */
00058     int rSize = 256;
00059     memset( &server->con, 0, sizeof( struct Connections ) );
00060     server->con.size = 0;
00061     server->con.rSize = rSize;
00062 
00063     server->con.clients = calloc( server->con.rSize, sizeof( struct Client ) );
00064     for ( int k = 0; k < server->con.rSize; ++k ) {
00065         bufInit( &server->con.clients[k].buffer );
00066     }
00067 
00068     server->fds = malloc( rSize * sizeof( struct pollfd ) );
00069     memset( server->fds, 0, rSize * sizeof( struct pollfd ) );
00070 
00071     clAdd( server, settings.addr, settings.sockID );
00072 
00073     return 0;
00074 }

00077 int srvRun( struct Server* server )
00078 {
00079     int size = 0;
00080     char buffer[BUFFER_SIZE];
00081     int x = 0;
00082 
00083 //      #pragma omp parallel shared(x)
00084     while ( 1 ) {
00085         x++;
00086         x %= 2;
00087                 
00088 //              printf("Poll begin\n");
00089 //              for ( int i = 0; i < server->size; ++i ) {
00090 //                      printf( "%d, ", server->fds[i].fd );
00091 //              }
00092         int ret = poll( server->fds, server->size, -1 );
00093 //              printf("\nPoll end\n");
00094 
00095         if ( server->fds[0].revents & POLLIN ) {
00096             if ( srvAccept( server ) || error_message_count != 0 )
00097                                 return 1;
00098         }
00099 
00100         for ( int i = 1; i < server->con.size; ++i ) {
00101             if ( server->con.clients[i].fd->revents & POLLIN ) {
00102                 size = read( server->con.clients[i].fd->fd, buffer, BUFFER_SIZE );
00103 
00104                                 if ( size <= 0 ) {
00105                     clDelete( server, &server->con.clients[i] );
00106                                                 break;
00107                 } else {
00108 
00109 //                                      write( 1, buffer, size );
00110                     bufWrite( &server->con.clients[i].buffer, buffer, size );
00111                     reqTestCompletness( &server->con.clients[i] );
00112                 }
00113 
00114             } else if ( server->con.clients[i].fd->revents & POLLOUT ) {
00115                 response( &server->con.clients[i] );
00116             } else if ( server->con.clients[i].fd->revents & POLLHUP ) {
00117                 clDelete( server, &server->con.clients[i] );
00118                 i = server->con.size; // exit for
00119             }
00120             if ( server->con.clients[i].fd->revents & POLLERR ) {
00121                 fprintf( stderr, "ERROR %d n %d\n", errno, server->con.clients[i].fd->fd );
00122 //                              return 9;
00123             }
00124         }
00125     }
00126 }

00129 void srvStop( struct Server* server )
00130 {
00131 
00132     for ( int i = 0; i < server->size; ++i ) {
00133         close( server->fds[i].fd );
00134     }
00135 
00136     close( settings.sockID );
00137 
00138     /* TODO Speicher freigeben! */
00139 }

00142 int srvAccept( struct Server* server )
00143 {
00144     int oldFlags = fcntl( settings.sockID, F_GETFL, O_NONBLOCK );
00145     fcntl( settings.sockID, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK | oldFlags );
00146 
00147     socklen_t sizeSock = sizeof( struct sockaddr_in );
00148     sizeSock = 0;
00149     int fd = -1;
00150     do {
00151         fd = accept( settings.sockID, ( struct sockaddr * ) & settings.addr, &sizeSock );
00152 
00153         if ( fd < 0 ) {
00154             if ( !( errno == EAGAIN  || errno == EWOULDBLOCK ) ) {
00155                 error_at_line( 0, 1, __FILE__, __LINE__, strerror( errno ), 0 );
00156                 return 1;
00157             }
00158         } else {
00159             clAdd( servers, settings.addr, fd );
00160         }
00161     } while ( fd > 0 );
00162 
00163     return 0;
00164 }
